TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HandleExceptionArgs extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies details of an exception that has occurred and the details of the associated HTTP response.
Gets or sets the exception that will be processed and returned in the response.
Docs.value: The exception that will be processed and returned in the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the exception is a <xref:System.Data.Services.DataServiceException>, the message of the exception will always be returned to the client, regardless of the <xref:System.Data.Services.HandleExceptionArgs.UseVerboseErrors%2A> value. If <xref:System.Data.Services.HandleExceptionArgs.UseVerboseErrors%2A> is true, the inner exceptions will also be returned to the client; otherwise only the <xref:System.Data.Services.DataServiceException> message will be returned.

Docs.returns: The exception that will be processed and returned in the response.

Docs.value: The string value that indicates the response format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All errors result in an error payload sent back from the service. This property informs the service author of the format the error that will be sent back. The value of this property will always be a valid Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) mime type.

Docs.returns: The string value that indicates the response format.

Docs.summary: Gets the status code that will be sent back in the HTTP header section of the response when an error occurs on the data service.
Docs.value: An integer value of the HTTP response status code.
Docs.returns: An integer value of the HTTP response status code.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the response has been written.
Docs.value: Boolean value that indicates whether response has been written.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value is true, the HTTP response headers and possibly part of the response body have already been sent to the client and cannot be altered.

Docs.returns: Boolean value that indicates whether response has been written.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether verbose errors will be returned.
Docs.value: The Boolean value that indicates whether verbose errors will be returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When UseVerboseErrors is set to true, all exception details will be returned in the response. Security Note: Setting this value to true may disclose information that should be private to the service.

Docs.returns: The Boolean value that indicates whether verbose errors will be returned.
